inputColumn.comments: Time slot number: - value in the interval [0, 287] for the aggregations by elementary period of 5 mn, value in the interval [0, 47] for the aggregations per 30 min period - value in the interval [0, 23] for the hourly aggregations (hour of the day). - value in the interval [1, 31] for the daily aggregations (day of the month). - value in the interval [1, 12] for the monthly aggregations (month of the year).

Traffic sub-set. The possible values of this field are : - total (total traffic, always provided if there are measurements in the period) - onNet ("on-net" traffic) - onNetIn (incoming "on-net" traffic) - onNetOut (outgoing "on-net" traffic) - intOnNetIn (incoming "internal on-net" traffic) - intOnNetOut (outgoing "internal on-net" traffic) - extOnNetIn (incoming "external on-net" traffic) - extOnNetOut (outgoing "external on-net" traffic) - offNet ("off-net" traffic) - offNetIn (incoming "off-net" traffic) - offNetOut (outgoing "off-net" traffic) Remark : Other values could be defined in later versions. In order to limit the constraints on the order of software updates, an application that uses this field should ignore the values that it does not know (an unknown value should not trigger any error).
Reliability of the aggregations. This is also the completeness ratio of the measurements. The value of this field is a real number between 0 and 100.
Number of phone calls that resulted in communication between the caller and the called party.
Number of phone calls said to be "accepted" (called party busy, called party does not answer, ...)
Number of phone calls that have failed.
Number of blocked calls either due to insufficient resources (eg: insufficient number of lines to the PSTN), or a deliberate blocking of calls to some destinations.
